intro: Coussarea longilaciniata, commonly known as the long-leaf coussarea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with white to pale pink petals, which are typically followed by small, capsule-like fruits. Native to tropical regions of Asia, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
